university.codexarcana.desc4: There are 8 chapters along the right, and 5 option buttons along the bottom. These let you change how the GUI looks and where it is, and some other options.
university.codexarcana.desc5: &6Pages unlock as you progress through the mod.&r You can only see what you can make.
university.codexarcana.desc6: Some things can be &6pinned&r, so you can see them outside of the book!
university.glyphbag.subtitle: Make a Glyph Bag
university.glyphbag.desc: The &bGlyph Bag&r can &6store up to 18 stacks of Glyphs&r inside it.
university.occulus.subtitle: Make the Occulus
university.occulus.desc1: The &bOcculus&r shows you what you need to do to reach the next &6Tier&r.
university.occulus.desc2: There are 5 Tiers. Many things in the mod are locked behind tiers, with higher tiers being vastly more powerful.
university.occulus.desc3: Along the left, there are 10 tabs. The first has already been explained; the second and third are explained in the quests to the right.
university.occulus.desc4: The rest are essentially &6lists of what is available&r in each Tier. None of it probably makes any sense yet, but it will be explained later.
university.affinity.title: Affinity and Faction
university.affinity.subtitle: Learn about the Affinity/Faction tab
university.affinity.desc1: At some point in the mod, you will have to join a &bFaction&r. Your faction will aid you and allow you access to some magics, but causes conflict with the others.
university.affinity.desc2: Every spell has a certain elemental &bAffinity&r. There are five affinities:
university.affinity.desc4: As you cast spells of an element, you gain affinity with it. The &6higher your affinity, the less Mana it takes to cast&r.
university.affinity.desc5: However, each element has an opposite. Having affinity with one element makes it more expensive to cast spells of the &6opposing element&r.
university.affinity.desc6:
Air opposed Earth.
Water opposes Fire.
Arcane opposes Ender.
university.beltoflocks.subtitle: Make a Belt of Locks
university.beltoflocks.desc: While wearing the &bBelt of Locks&r, your &6affinities will be locked&r.
university.sorcery.title: Sorcery
university.sorcery.subtitle: Learn about the Sorcery tab
university.sorcery.desc1: The &bSorcery&r tab is basically just a list of spell parts, and what tier they're unlocked in.
university.sorcery.desc2: However, each part also has a &6progress bar&r. The more you use spells with that part, the more it progresses.
university.sorcery.desc3: Once the bar is completely full, that spell becomes &6rote&r. Rote spells are basically memorized, used so much they've become second nature.
university.sorcery.desc4: This is mostly important for the &6Book of Rote&r, which has a quest elsewhere.
university.sorcery.desc5: Additionally, spells that require a &6faction&r will have that faction's icon in the corner.
university.spellscribing.title: Spellscribing
university.spellscribing.subtitle: Make and use the Inscription Table
university.spellscribing.desc1: Before you can make a spell, you have to say what you want it to do.
university.spellscribing.desc2: Place the &bInscription Table&r, and give it some &bArcanist's Ink&r, &bVellum&r, and &bArcane Ash&r. The latter three will be used up, so give it a bunch.
university.spellscribing.desc3: There are three rows. The top row is dedicated to the spell's &6Shape&r, basically what it targets.
university.spellscribing.desc4: At tier 1, you can only aim at yourself or the block you click on, but more shapes are unlocked as you progress. Each is described in the &6Codex Arcana&r.
university.spellscribing.desc5: The second row is for the spell's &6Effect&r, what the spell actually does.
university.spellscribing.desc6: There is a huge range of spell effects. Each one is described in the book.
university.spellscribing.desc7: The third row is for &6Modifiers&r, though none are unlocked at Tier 1.
university.spellscribing.desc8: You can have up to three modifiers. They will &6add arrow buttons to the upper rows&r, so you can increase/decrease the range, damage, etc of those parts.
university.spellscribing.desc9: At the top right, you can see the spell's &6complexity&r and the max allowed (which increases by Tier). It will also display the spell's &6mana cost&r.
university.spellscribing.desc10: Under that, you can see how much Ink, Vellum, and Ash it will take to inscribe. If all are in the Table, click the green arrow at the top to make the Spell Recipe.
university.manarituals.title: Rituals
university.manarituals.subtitle: Learn how to do rituals
university.manarituals.desc1: &6Rituals&r provide more powerful or more permanent effects than spells.
university.manarituals.desc2: Each ritual has a certain recipe, see its page in the Codex Arcana. You can &6pin&r this recipe so you can see it while not in the book.
university.manarituals.desc3: Use &bWizard Chalk&r on the ground, matching the pattern of the ritual recipe. Each X is somewhere you need to place Chalk.
university.manarituals.desc4: Once the pattern has been drawn on the ground, use &bPurified Vinteum Dust&r on the center mark. If the pattern matches a ritual, it will change color and show you where you need to place items.
university.manarituals.desc5: Right-click the Chalk to place the item on it. You don't have to be holding the item in your hand, you just have to have it.
university.manarituals.desc6: Use the Dust on the center again to begin the ritual. Some rituals require the use of the &bManaweaver's Wand&r; see its quest to see how to use that.
university.ritualkit.title: Quick Rituals
university.ritualkit.subtitle: Make a Ritual Kit
university.ritualkit.desc1: The &bRitual Kit&r allows you to &6quickly cast a ritual without placing the Chalk circle&r. You can have up to 8 Rituals per Kit.
university.ritualkit.desc2: Sneak right-click the Ritual Kit on the center Chalk of a ritual circle that is ready to go. This will save that ritual to the Kit.
university.ritualkit.desc3: Put Ritual Chalk and any other items the ritual needs into the RItual Kit, then &6use it on the ground to cast the ritual&r.
university.ritualkit.desc4: This can be done as many times as you can afford.
university.spellcrafting.title: Spellcrafting
university.spellcrafting.subtitle: Make a spell
university.spellcrafting.desc1: Open your &bSpell Recipe&r and &6collect everything it says you will need&r.
university.spellcrafting.desc2: On the ground, place chalk according to the &6Ritual of Arcana&r, and use Purified Vinteum Dust on the center chalk.
university.spellcrafting.desc3: Place the Spell Recipe into the center Chalk. Place the spell's reagents (the items it needs to craft) where the Chalk says.
university.spellcrafting.desc4: Use the Dust again to begin the ritual. Draw the Patterns it shows using the &6Manaweaver's Wand&r (or any other method you have).
university.spellcrafting.desc5: Repeat as needed, and the ritual will end, finishing the &bSpell&r! Use it to &6choose its icon and name&r, then hit escape to close the menu.
university.spellcrafting.desc6: Right-click the spell to cast it!
university.magictips.title: Magic Tips
university.magictips.subtitle: Some misc stuff about magic
university.magictips.desc1: Your max mana is based on your &6magic level&r, which is increased by casting spells.
university.magictips.desc2: The mana GUI (which we recommend setting to only be visible while holding magic items, in the Codex Arcana) shows your current Mana, the Mana cost of your held spell, and your progress towards the next magic level.
university.magictips.desc3: Your magic level is capped, with the cap increasing for each Tier. The higher your Tier, the higher your magic level can reach.
university.spellbook.subtitle: Make a Spell Book
university.spellbook.desc1: The &bSpell Book&r can &6hold 50 spells&r, and allows you to &6cast 8 of them&r (not at the same time, obviously).
university.spellbook.desc2: Hold control and right-click it to open its GUI. The slots on the right are for storage, and the slots on the left are for quick-casting.
university.spellbook.desc3: Whole holding the Book, hold down &6Z&r to show all spells in the quick-cast slots. Hover over one, then release Z to select it.
university.spellbook.desc4: Right-click the Spell Book to cast the currently selected spell.
university.staveswands.title: For the Distinguished Wizard
university.staveswands.subtitle: Make a Staff or Wand
university.staveswands.desc1: &bMagic Staffs and Wands&r are basically just &6fancy-looking&r and not much else.
university.staveswands.desc2: They can be found in dungeons, but those have &6limited uses&r.
university.staveswands.desc3: To set the spell, combine it with the Spell item in the &6Manaweaving Table&r. Don't forget to use the Manaweaver's Wand! Check JEI or the book.
university.staffpilgrim.subtitle: Make the Staff of the Pilgrim
university.staffpilgrim.desc: When held in the offhand, the &bStaff of the Pilgrim&r makes you more agile.
university.factions.title: Factions
university.factions.subtitle: Learn about factions
university.factions.desc1: At the end of tier 2, you will have to join one of three &bfactions&r. You can only choose one, and you &ccannot undo&r this decision. Frankly, I suggest &6making a creative world to see what they give&r, since their spells etc aren't visible until after you choose.
university.factions.desc2: Each faction provides &6access to certain magic spells and items&r, based on the faction's theme. These factions and their themes are:
university.factions.desc3: &7Council of Wizards&r - &6Defense and damage mitigation.&r  Teleportation.  Mana capacity.  Allies spawn in the overworld, the nether can be particularly dangerous.
university.factions.desc4: &cDemons of the Nether&r - &6Power without restraint.&r  Nether transport.  Fire protection.  Allies spawn in the nether, making it particularly safe.  The overworld will be more dangerous to you.
university.factions.desc5: &dFey Courts&r - &6Movement and trickery.&r  Flight. Nature.  Allies spawn in the overworld, the nether can be particularly dangerous.
university.factions.desc6: &8Undead&r - &6Relentless endurance, spirit magic.&r  Possession and Mind Vision.  A shift in paradigm from the other factions, a very different feel, but a capacity for a large amount of power.  Has some passive abilities and downsides.  You &ojoin&r the other factions, you &lbecome&r undead.
university.factions.desc7: Once you've chosen a faction, perform its joining ritual.
university.factionhorns.title: Faction Horns
university.factionhorns.subtitle: Make a Faction Horn
university.factionhorns.desc1: &bFaction Horns&r will &6summon a group of members of that faction&r to help in battle.
university.factionhorns.desc2: It only lasts for a relatively short duration, and has a &6very very long cooldown&r.
university.factionhorns.desc3: Obviously, you can only use the Horn of your own faction.
university.ironbell.title: Buyer's Remorse
university.ironbell.subtitle: Use the Ritual of the Iron Bell
university.ironbell.desc1: Did you join the Demons of the Nether and then realize that, wait a second, &oPvE is awful&r?
university.ironbell.desc2: Good news! The &bRitual of the Iron Bell&r allows you to &6trade for relics from other factions&r!
university.ironbell.desc3: It will summon &6The Broker&r, a mysterious entity who sells relics in return for other relics and &6Marks&r.
university.ironbell.desc4: Each faction has soldiers that randomly spawn around the world. Kill them to pick up Marks of that faction.
university.ironbell.desc5: The trades it provides are &6random&r, changed every time it is summoned. It will only stick around for about half a day, though you can dispel him early by attacking him.
university.ironbell.desc6: &cBe warned&r: factions do not like when you use their things. Marks &oare&r basically dog tags, after all. Using another faction's relic can start a &6raid&r, spawning waves of that faction's soldiers near your location.
university.leylinesbracelet.subtitle: Make the Ley Line Bracelet and some Unguent of Seeing
university.leylinesbracelet.desc1: The &bLey Line Bracelet&r will allow you to &6cast while drained of mana&r, while near "motes of residual magic".
university.leylinesbracelet.desc2: These motes appear in places where magic is used often, and are visible after using &bUnguent of Seeing&r.
university.emberglow.subtitle: Make the Emberglow Bracelet
university.emberglow.desc1: The &bEmberglow Bracelet&r will &6fully negate damage from fire and lava&r.
university.emberglow.desc2: It &cdoes not last forever&r and will have to be recharged, though it lasts for a fairly long time.
university.trickery.title: Here's a Little Lesson in Trickery
university.trickery.subtitle: Make the Bracelet of Trickery
university.trickery.desc1: The &bBracelet of Tricker&r will give you certain buffs while sneaking.
university.trickery.desc2: It will &6make you invisible&r (including armor and held items), and punching with an empty hand will &6send your target flying&r.
university.hellfirestaff.title: Hellfire! Dark Fire!
university.hellfirestaff.subtitle: Make the Hellfire Staff
university.hellfirestaff.desc1: The &bHellfire Staff&r works like regular Staves, and &6makes any fire-based spells significantly more powerful&r.
university.hellfirestaff.desc2: Hellfire is much more powerful, &6bypassing fire resistance&r.
university.arcanecrown.subtitle: Make the Arcane Crown
university.arcanecrown.desc: The &bArcane Crown&r will &6decrease the mana cost of spells&r, &6increase your mana pool&r, and &6sometimes dispel harmful effects&r.
university.spectralelytra.subtitle: Make the Spectral Elytra
university.spectralelytra.desc1: The &bSpectral Elytra&r will &6boost you forward when flying&r. You can sneak to stop.
university.coffin.subtitle: Make a Coffin
university.coffin.desc: Players in the Undead faction can sleep in a &bCoffin&r to &6restore some soul power&r.
university.brittlebone.subtitle: Make a Ring of Brittle Bone
university.brittlebone.desc: The &bRing of Brittle Bone&r allows Undead players to &6regain more soul from killing&r.
university.manaweaverswand.subtitle: Make the Manaweaver's Wand
university.manaweaverswand.desc1: The &bManaweaver's Wand&r is required for &6manaweaving&r, which is logical.
university.manaweaverswand.desc2: Manaweaving is the art of drawing &6Manaweaving Patterns&r in the air, which are used in certain rituals and recipes.
university.manaweaverswand.desc3: You can find a list of Manaweave Patterns in the &6Occulus&r. Hold right-click with the Wand then draw the pattern to cast it, and it will hover in the air.
university.manaweaverswand.desc4: If something nearby can use that Pattern, it will be absorbed.
university.manaweavebottle.title: Manaweave in a Bottle
university.manaweavebottle.subtitle: Collect Manaweave in a Bottle
university.manaweavebottle.desc1: Manaweave Patterns... aren't the easiest thing to draw. You don't really want to be standing there for an hour trying to draw a triangle when you just want to make a spell.
university.manaweavebottle.desc2: If you &6use a Bottle on a Manaweave Pattern&r, you will collect it as a &bManaweave in a Bottle&r!
university.manaweavebottle.desc3: These can be stored and then &6thrown&r on the ground at any time to quickly summon the Pattern again.
university.manaweaveprojector.subtitle: Make the Manaweave Projector
university.manaweaveprojector.desc1: The &bManaweave Projector&r will draw Mana from nearby players and, when activated, it will &6draw a Pattern above them&r.
university.manaweaveprojector.desc2: By default, it will only draw the triangle pattern. To change the pattern, use &bManaweaving Patterns&r, which you buy from the Manaweaver villager (who uses the Manaweaving Altar as its workstation).
university.manaweaveprojector.desc3: Theoretically, you could have one of each Pattern and then &6automatically collect them with Bottles&r.
university.cantrips.title: Cantrips
university.cantrips.subtitle: Learn about cantrips
university.cantrips.desc1: &bCantrips&r are spells that cost nothing, and are made by &6quickly casting two Manaweave Patterns in succession&r.
university.cantrips.desc2: Control right-click the Manaweaver's Wand to open the cantrip gui. There, you will see up to 6 cantrips, based on your Tier.
university.cantrips.desc3: You can &6set the shape combination&r for each, and them casting those shapes will cast the cantrip.
university.cantrips.desc4: The first cantrip simply lights a fire. The second dispels harmful effects. The third summons the &6Grimoire&r, which has a quest.
university.cantrips.desc5: You can also set 3 cantrips to &6cast any spell you give it&r, minus any modifiers it has.
university.grimoire.subtitle: Get the Grimoire
university.grimoire.desc1: The &bGrimoire&r is basically the &6Spell Book equivalent of an Ender Chest&r.
university.grimoire.desc2: Any spell you put in a Grimoire is available in any Grimoire you use!
university.manaweavingaltar.subtitle: Make the Manaweaving Altar
university.manaweavingaltar.desc1: The &bManaweaving Altar&r is used to &6craft things using items and Patterns&r.
university.manaweavingaltar.desc2: Place the item ingredients into the Altar, and then &6cast the Manaweave Patterns near the Altar&r.
university.manaweavingaltar.desc3: You can see the Patterns along the rim of the Altar. Use the Wand on the Altar to remove the most recent Pattern, if you did the wrong one (which you will, often).
university.manaweavingaltar.desc4: Some recipes requrie you be a certain tier. There's not really a way to show that in quests, so &6the quests further from this one need higher tier&r.
university.crystalmemories.subtitle: Make a Crystal of Memories
university.crystalmemories.desc1: The &bCrystal of Memories&r &6stores experience&r, up to 2,000 points!
university.crystalmemories.desc2: Sneak right-click it to change between inserting and extracting, and hold right-click to use.
university.manacrysfrag.title: Mana Crystal Fragment
university.manacrysfrag.subtitle: Make the Mana Crystal Fragment
university.manacrysfrag.desc1: The &bMana Crystal Fragment&r (and the &bMana Gems&r) &6store Mana&r.
university.manacrysfrag.desc2: Sneak right-click it to change between inserting and extracting, and hold right-click to use.
university.wardingcandle.subtitle: Make the Warding Candle
university.wardingcandle.desc: The &bWarding Candle&r, while lit, will &6prevent spawns in a 32 block radius&r.
university.bookofrote.title: The Best Thing
university.bookofrote.subtitle: Make the Book of Rote
university.bookofrote.desc1: The &bBook of Rote&r allows you to &6combine rote spell parts on the fly&r to make spells.
university.bookofrote.desc2: These spells are identical to normal spells, but you don't have to go through the lengthy process of crafting them. You simply combine the parts, and that's it!
university.bookofrote.desc3: Rote Modifiers don't take up any slot, they simply provide the arrow buttons to all spell parts.
university.bookofrote.desc4: Rote spells also have &66 slots&r, so you can have &6up to 5 components&r taking into account the shape.
university.bookofrote.desc5: You still have room for 8 spells, and it controls the same as a Spell Book.
university.slipstream.subtitle: Make a Slipstream Generator
university.slipstream.desc1: While standing either &650 blocks above or below&r a &bSlipstream Generator&r, you can &6look up to go up&r and &6look down to go down&r.
university.slipstream.desc2: The steeper you look, the faster you move. You can sneak midair to stay at your current elevation.
university.witherguard.title: Was That Supposed to Hurt?
university.witherguard.subtitle: Make the Bracelet of Antidote and Witherguard Amulet
university.witherguard.desc: The &bBracelet of Antidote&r will &6nullify poison&r, and the &bWitherguard Amulet&r will &6nullify withering&r.
university.amuletward.subtitle: Make the Amulet of Warding
university.amuletward.desc: The &bAmulet of Warding&r will &6reduce incoming magic damage by 10%%&r.
university.battlemage.subtitle: Make the Amulet of the Battlemage
university.battlemage.desc: While wearing the &bAmulet of the Battlemage&r, your &6spell damage is increased while holding a sword in your other hand&r.
university.minersrings.title: Miner's Rings
university.minersrings.subtitle: Make the various miner Rings
university.minersrings.desc1: The &6Break&r spell, by default, is only &6equivalent to a Stone Pickaxe&r. The &bBreak Rings&r &6increase its mining level&r to be like either Iron or Diamond.
university.minersrings.desc2: The &bRings of Fortune/Silk&r will &6apply Fortune or Silk Touch&r to the Break spell.
university.minersrings.desc3: &bCollector's Rings&r will &6teleport drops to your inventory&r when you use the Break spell.
university.enderguard.subtitle: Make the Enderguard Amulet
university.enderguard.desc: The &bEnderguard Amulet&r will &6teleport exploding creepers away from you&r.
university.magearmor.title: Mage Armor
university.magearmor.subtitle: Make a set of Mage armor
university.magearmor.desc1: When you wear the full set of &bMage armor&r, it will &6boost your max mana and mana regen&r.
university.magearmor.desc2: It will also &6repair itself&r by draining Mana Crystal Fragments in your inventory.
university.sewingkit.subtitle: Make a Sorcerous Sewing Kit
university.sewingkit.desc1: The &bSorcerous Sewing Kit&r is required to &6repair Mage armor&r.
university.sewingkit.desc2: Place the armor on the &6Runic Anvil&r, then &6Infused Silk&r on top. Then, use the Sewing Kit on the Anvil to repair the armor.
university.manacrystal.subtitle: Make a Mana Crystal
university.manacrystal.desc: Standing near the &bMana Crystal&r will &6rapidly refill your Mana&r.
university.eldritchorb.subtitle: Make the Eldritch Orb
university.eldritchorb.desc1: The &bEldritch Orb&r will &6automatically damage hostile mobs&r.
university.eldritchorb.desc2: It doesn't do much damage, but you can &6enchant it&r.
university.magicbroom.subtitle: Make the Magic Broom
university.magicbroom.desc: Place the &bMagic Broom&r on an inventory, and it will &6pick up dropped items&r nearby.
university.vortexbroom.subtitle: Make the Vortex Broom
university.vortexbroom.desc: The &bVortex Broom&r does the same, but also &6pulls nearby items towards it&r to increase its range.
university.arcanesentry.subtitle: Make an Arcane Sentry
university.arcanesentry.desc1: The &bArcane Sentry&r will &6shoot magic bolts at hostile creaturs in its range&r.
university.arcanesentry.desc2: You have to give it &6Vinteum Dust&r to power it. You can also toggle if it &6targets players&r.
university.bubbleboat.title: Hamster Ball
university.bubbleboat.subtitle: Make a Bubble Boat
university.bubbleboat.desc1: The &bBubble Boat&r is basically a &6faster, more controllable boat&r.
university.bubbleboat.desc2: If you deploy it underwater, it will &6very quickly take you to the surface&r.
university.brimstonecharm.subtitle: Make the Brimstone Charm
university.brimstonecharm.desc1: The &bBrimstone Charm&r is used to &6greatly increase the speed the Runeforge works at&r.
university.brimstonecharm.desc2: It can also be used to make the &6Brimstone Boat&r, which works like the Bubble Boat but works on Lava.
university.transitorytunnel.title: Portable Hole
university.transitorytunnel.subtitle: Make the Transitory Tunnel
university.transitorytunnel.desc: The &bTransitory Tunnel&r can be used to &6create a temporary tunnel through blocks&r, which will fill back up after some time.
university.runeforge.subtitle: Make the Runeforge
university.runeforge.desc1: The &bRuneforge&r is basically a &6free-burning furnace&r that is also &6required for certain recipes&r.
university.runeforge.desc2: Any &6Campfire recipes are twice as fast&r, but &cFurnace/Blast Furnace recipes are twice as slow&r.
university.runeforge.desc3: It can accept up to 16 items at a time, but is not faster for it.
university.runeforge.desc4: Simply right-click to insert or extract items; the Runeforge has no GUI.
university.runedoubling.title: Free Ore Doubling
university.runedoubling.subtitle: Learn how to double ores in the Runeforge
university.runedoubling.desc1: Directly touching either side of the Runeforge, place two &bPedestals&r and then place &bRed&r, &bYellow&r, or &bOrange Chimerite Crystals&r on them, and the Runeforge will &6double ores&r.
university.runedoubling.desc2: This can be done as often as you like, but remember that the Runeforge is still really really slow.
university.runescribing.title: Runescribing
university.runescribing.subtitle: Make a Runescribing setup
university.runescribing.desc1: &6Runes&r are special items that are used in certain crafting recipes. They themselves have a very unique crafting mechanic.
university.runescribing.desc2: Place the &bRunescribing Table&r, then place inside it a &bRunesmith's Hammer&r and &bChisel&r, as well as a blank &bRune Pattern&r.
university.runescribing.desc3: On the left, you will see a pattern of dots. You can &6click between the dots to form a line&r connecting them.
university.runescribing.desc4: Each Rune Pattern has its own shape you have to draw in this way. It is suggested to &6pin the recipe&r using the book.
university.runescribing.desc5: &cAny mistakes you made are permanent.&r You will have to throw away the Pattern and start over.
university.runescribing.desc6: Once the pattern has been drawn exactly, it will become a &bRune Pattern&r of that rune.
university.runescribing.desc7: A Pattern one line from being completed:
university.runerecipe.title: Runscribing Recipes
university.runerecipe.subtitle: Buy a Runescribing Recipe
university.runerecipe.desc1: You can buy &bRunescribing Recipes&r for every Rune Pattern from the Ritualist villager (whose workstation is the Runescribing Table).
university.runerecipe.desc2: You can place the Recipe in the top right slot of the Runescribing Table to &6see the pattern recipe&r.
university.runesmithing.title: Runesmithing
university.runesmithing.subtitle: Smith a Rune
university.runesmithing.desc1: To actually make the Rune, place down a &bRunic Anvil&r, then place the Rune Pattern on it.
university.runesmithing.desc2: Then, place the item that that Pattern needs (generally either a &bSuperheated Vinteum Ingot&r or &bSuperheated Purified Vinteum Ingot&r). If the recipe is valid, it will &6glow with a magic circle&r.
university.runesmithing.desc3: Use the &6Runesmith's Hammer&r on it a few times (check the recipe), and eventually it will turn into the finished &bRune&r.
university.runeritual.title: Reusable Rituals
university.runeritual.subtitle: Make some Rune: Ritual (Metal)...s
university.runeritual.desc1: The &bRune: Ritual (Metal)&r can be &6used in place of Ritual Chalk&r, and it will &6not disappear when used&r.
university.runeritual.desc2: As a consequence, it &ccannot be used with the Ritual Kit&r.
university.runeenchants.title: Runic Enchantments
university.runeenchants.subtitle: Learn how to enchant with Runes
university.runeenchants.desc1: &bRunic enchanting&r is the process of &6enchanting items using Runes&r.
university.runeenchants.desc2: Certain Runes can be enchanted in the &6Manaweaving Altar&r (see the &oEnchantments&r chapter of the Codex Arcana for each recipe), which can then be applied to certain items in the &6Runic Anvil&r.
university.runeenchants.desc3: First, place the item you want to enchant. Second, place the enchanted Rune. Finally, hammer it until the enchantment is transferred.
university.runeenchants.desc4: Every vanilla enchantment can be applied in this way, as well as &6certain unique enchantments&r (see the next two quests).
university.auraenchants.title: Aura Enchantments
university.auraenchants.subtitle: Enchant a Rune: Aura
university.auraenchants.desc1: &bAura Enchantments&r use your Mana to provide some sort of buff to yourself and nearby friendlies.
university.auraenchants.desc2: Check the Codex Arcana for a description of each.
university.selfishbelt.title: Lone Wolf
university.selfishbelt.subtitle: Make the Selfish Belt
university.selfishbelt.desc1: Aura effects will also apply their effects to nearby friendly entities, &6at an additional Mana cost&r.
university.selfishbelt.desc2: Some may not consider that cost worth the benefit. Some may also simply dislike these "friendly" entities. In either case, you can use the &bSelfish Belt&r.
university.selfishbelt.desc3: The Selfish Belt will &6limit Aura effects to yourself&r, which will also &6lower the Mana cost&r.
university.uniqueruneenchants.title: Unique Runic Enchantments
university.uniqueruneenchants.subtitle: Make each unique type of Runic Enchant
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc1: &bBouncy&r can be applied to boots, and will &6negate fall damage&r, causing you to &6bounce upwards instead&r.
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc2: &bCloudstep&r is also applied to boots, and will &6allow you to jump in midair&r. Each level adds another jump.
university.uniqueruneenchants.desc3: &bMultishot&r and &bQuick Charge&r can be applied to bows; their effects should be fairly obvious from the name.
university.constructs.title: Constructs
university.constructs.subtitle: Make a Construct Workbench
university.constructs.desc1: &6Constructs&r are basically little magic robots that can perform certain functions.
university.constructs.desc2: They have 5 &bpart slots&r, with the parts dictating what they can do. They can break and place blocks, move items, harvest and plant crops and trees, kill and breed mobs, and more.
university.constructs.desc3: The material the part is made out of effects the construct's stats.
university.constructs.desc4: We've added tooltips that say each part's stats, what they do, and when they're available.
university.constworkbench.subtitle: Make your Construct
university.constworkbench.desc1: Place each part into the &bConstruct Workbench&r.
university.constworkbench.desc2: Place 8 &bChimerite Crystals&r near the Workbench, within 5 blocks (line of sight not needed).
university.constworkbench.desc3: Cast spells on each of the Crystals to &6imbue them with the spell's elemental affinity&r. Each Crystal adds a point of that affinity to the Construct, changing it in some way:
university.constworkbench.desc4:
• Air: increases speed
• Arcane: increases magic damage and resistance
• Earth: increases physical damage and resistance
• Ender: increases carry capacity
• Fire: increases fire attack duration
• Water: increases buoyancy
university.constworkbench.desc5: Affinity conflict does not matter, nor does the color of the Crystal.
university.constworkbench.desc6: Once you're ready, &6right-click the Workbench with an empty hand&r.
university.diagnostic.subtitle: Make the Construct Diagnostic Rod
university.diagnostic.desc1: You can use the &bConstruct Diagnostic Rod&r on a construct to &6see what it's thinking&r.
university.diagnostic.desc2: This will include what it's currently doing, its health and armor, what it's capable of doing, and what it's holding.
university.controlrod.subtitle: Make the Construct Control Rod
university.controlrod.desc1: The &bConstruct Control Rod&r allows you to &6control your constructs&r.
university.controlrod.desc2: Use the Rod on the construct to tell the Rod which construct you are controlling. The next use of the Rod will dictate which action it will do.
university.controlrod.desc3: Use the Rod on the construct again to tell it to &6stay where it is&r.
university.controlrod.desc4: Use the Rod on an empty Construct Workbench to &6return it to the bench, uncrafting it&r, allowing you to swap its parts.
university.controlrod.desc5: Use the Rod on a block to tell it to &6follow you&r, defending you if it is capable of doing so.
university.controlrod.desc6: Use the Rod on a &6Lodestar&r to tell it to do what the Lodestar says. See its quest for more details.
university.lodestar.title: Complex Orders
university.lodestar.subtitle: Make a Lodestar
university.lodestar.desc1: The &bLodestar&r allows you to &6create a set of orders for a construct to follow&r.
university.lodestar.desc2: In its GUI, the left will show a list of potential orders. Click them to add them to the set.
university.lodestar.desc3: Click an order in the set to &6configure it&r. To remove an order, &6hold right click then left click once&r while hovering over it.
university.lodestar.desc4: You can give the Lodestar a redstone signal to &6disable it&r.
university.lodestar.desc5: Here is a very simple tree farm. First, it chops trees in an area. Then, it takes saplings from a Chest. Finally, it places a block at a certain coordinate (that block being the sapling). Since that's the last order, it resets to the first step and waits.
university.runemarking.subtitle: Make a Rune: Marking
university.runemarking.desc1: The &bRune: Marking&r is how you &6define coordinates&r for the Lodestar and certain other things.
university.runemarking.desc2: Right-click a block to set the Rune to its coordinates. If you hold the Rune, you will see where it is bound to.
university.runemarking.desc3: If you hold bound Runes in either hand, you will &6see the volume between both corners&r.
university.arsecclesia.title: Necronomicon
university.arsecclesia.subtitle: Make the Ars Ecclesia
university.arsecclesia.desc1: The &bArs Ecclesia&r is &eEidolon&r's guide book. It has documentation on most things in the mod.
university.arsecclesia.desc2: The majority is visible from the start, but some parts of Theurgy and all of Mystical Signs are unlocked as you progress.
university.arsecclesia.desc3: The book is not only a guide, it is also a tool. Theurgic chants are chosen using the Mystical Signs section.
university.arsecclesia.desc4: The mod is not finished, so there are a couple dead ends. More content will be added in future though!
university.theurgy.title: Theurgy
university.theurgy.subtitle: Make an Altar with a Straw Effigy
university.theurgy.desc1: Theurgy is centered around &6gaining favor with the dark lord&r. As you gain favor, you unlock more &6Signs&r, which unlock more &6Chants&r.
university.theurgy.desc2: Progresing through Theurgy is required for some later items in other sections.
university.theurgy.desc3: &6Signs&r are representations of magical concepts. As you start with no knowledge, you don't have any by default.
university.theurgy.desc4: The book says that some basic Signs "may be known to earthly magical practitioners..."
university.theurgy.desc5: All Theurgy is done near the Altar. Place 6 &bWooden Altars&r in a 3x2 rectangle, and place a &bStraw Effigy&r on top.
university.wickedsign.title: Wicked Sign
university.wickedsign.subtitle: Acquire and use the Wicked Sign
university.wickedsign.desc1: Throwing your book to a Witch will give you the &bWicked Sign&r... sign.
university.wickedsign.desc2: This will also unlock a new page called &6Dark Prayer&r in the Theurgy section.
university.wickedsign.desc3: The Dark Prayer chant will &6gain a small amount of favor&r with the dark lord. It can only be cast &conce per day&r, so it is suggested to start early.
university.wickedsign.desc4: Do this for some days to get enough favor to continue.
university.sacredsign.title: Sacred Sign
university.sacredsign.subtitle: Acquire the Sacred Sign
university.sacredsign.desc1: Give the Ars Ecclesia to a &6Cleric Villager&r to get &bSacred Sign&r.
university.sacredsign.desc2: It currently has no uses, but will in the future.
university.altarboosts.title: Altar Boosts
university.altarboosts.subtitle: Make the various Altar-boosting items
university.altarboosts.desc1: Placing &6occult objects&r on top of the Altar can improve its &6power&r and &6capacity&r.
university.altarboosts.desc2: The more power, the more effective prayers and chants are at gaining favor.
university.altarboosts.desc3: The more capacity, the more magical energy can be imbued into creatures and objects.
university.altarboosts.desc4: There are 3 types of objects you can use: &blights&r, &bskulls&r, and potted &bherbs&r. You can see the effects of each in their tasks.
university.altarboosts.desc5: Only the highest of each type is used. If you have a Candle, a Torch would be worthless, etc.
university.bloodsign.title: Blood Sign
university.bloodsign.subtitle: Acquire the Blood Sign
university.bloodsign.desc1: Once you've gained enough favor (through daily uses of the Dark Prayer), you will unlock the &bBlood Sign&r.
university.bloodsign.desc2: Blood Sign unlocks the &6Sacrifice Animal&r chant. Place a &bGoblet&r on top of the Altar, kill a passive mob nearby, and then perform the Sacrifice Animal chant to &6gain a large amount of favor&r.
university.bloodsign.desc3: This can only be done once per day. This will also unlock the &6Soul Sign&r.
university.soulsign.title: Soul Sign
university.soulsign.subtitle: Acquire the Soul Sign and get an Unholy Symbol
university.soulsign.desc1: &bSoul Sign&r is required to use the chant &6Touch of Darkness&r.
university.soulsign.desc2: Chant it while looking at certain dropped items to convert them into others.
university.soulsign.desc3: Currently the only thing it can make is the &bUnholy Symbol&r, an item that is used in some crafting recipes.
university.soulsign.desc4: It is kept when used in recipes, so you can use it more than once.
university.elderstatue.title: Stone Altar
university.elderstatue.subtitle: Make a Stone Altar
university.elderstatue.desc: The &bStone Altar&r and &bElder Statue&r can replace the Wooden Altar and Straw Effigy of your Altar to make it &6more powerful&r.
university.mindsign.title: Mind Sign
university.mindsign.subtitle: Sacrifice a Villager and acquire the Mind Sign
university.mindsign.desc1: With the Soul Sign, you should have learned the chant &6Sacrifice Villager&r. It is performed in the same way as Sacrifice Creature, just with a Villager.
university.mindsign.desc2: This will grant a &6very large amount of favor&r, and unlocks the &bMind Sign&r.
university.mindsign.desc3: The Mind Sign &ccurrently has no use&r, unfortunately. It will be expanded upon in the future.
university.brazier.title: Rituals
university.brazier.subtitle: Make a Brazier
university.brazier.desc1: &6Rituals&r are used to create new items, summon monsters, influence mobs, and more.
university.brazier.desc2: Place a &bBrazier&r where you want to perform the ritual, and place some &bStone Hands&r nearby.
university.brazier.desc3: In the Ars Ecclesia, there are pages for each ritual. The item at the top goes in the Brazier and the items in the bottom go in the Stone Hands.
university.brazier.desc4: Once all the items are ready, &6light the Brazier&r to start the ritual.
university.necroticfocus.subtitle: Make a Necrotic Focus
university.necroticfocus.desc1: The &bNecrotic Focus&r can be used in place of Stone Hands, and &6must be used in some cases&r.
university.necroticfocus.desc2: Basically, if the item is in front of this texture, it uses the Necrotic Focus instead of the Hand.
university.eidsoul.subtitle: Get Soul Shards
university.eidsoul.desc1: All rituals, as well as certain items, use &bSoul Shards&r.
university.eidsoul.desc2: You can make Soul Shards using the &6Crystallization Ritual&r, which will kill nearby undead and convert them into Soul Shards.
university.eidsoul.desc3: &6Enchanted Ash&r is helpful for collecting them, since &6mobs can't cross it&r.
university.eidsummon.title: Lesser Summoning
university.eidsummon.subtitle: Summon an undead monster
university.eidsummon.desc1: There are several rituals for &bspawning undead monsters&r.
university.eidsummon.desc2: You can summon Zombies, Skeletons, Phantoms, Wither Skeletons, Husks, Drowned, Strays, and Wraiths.
university.timerituals.title: Time Rituals
university.timerituals.subtitle: Change the time with a ritual
university.timerituals.desc: The &bRitual of Daylight&r and &bRitual of Moonlight&r can change the time to either day or night. Guess which is which.
university.otherrituals.title: Misc Rituals
university.otherrituals.subtitle: Learn about the other rituals
university.otherrituals.desc1: There are also &bother rituals&r that aren't really worth an entire quest.
university.otherrituals.desc2: They can &6lure mobs&r, &6repel monsters&r, and more. These rituals &6last forever once started&r, with no upkeep cost. They stop if you break the Brazier.
university.sanguineamulet.title: Saving for Later
university.sanguineamulet.subtitle: Make the Sanguine Amulet
university.sanguineamulet.desc1: The &bSanguine Amulet&r, while your health is full, will &6fill itself with health points&r.
university.sanguineamulet.desc2: Whenever you have less than full health, it will &6rapidly heal you&r using its stored health.
university.sanguineamulet.desc3: The creation ritual also needs &6twenty hearts' worth of living creatures&r nearby.
university.swordofsapping.subtitle: Make the Sword of Sapping
university.swordofsapping.desc1: The &bSword of Sapping&r will &6deal wither damage&r.
university.swordofsapping.desc2: The wither damage will also &6heal the user&r. Mobs killed also have a chance of dropping Soul Shards.
university.swordofsapping.desc3: The creation ritual also needs &6ten hearts' worth of living creatures&r nearby.
university.eidartifice.title: Artifice
university.eidartifice.subtitle: Make a Magic Workbench and Crucible
university.eidartifice.desc1: The &bMagic Workbench&r works exactly like you'd expect. Put items where the recipe says, and make the item. It can also do normal Crafting Table recipes.
university.eidartifice.desc2: The &bCrucible&r is a bit harder to use. &6Place it over a heat source&r (like Lava, Fire, or a Magma Block), and fill it with Water to start.
university.eidartifice.desc3: Crucible recipes have &6steps&r. You have to do everything in the first step and then &6wait for the water to change color&r, then do the next step, and so on.
university.eidartifice.desc4: If the step shows an item, simply &6throw the item in&r. If the step shows a circular arrow, that means you have to &6stir the Crucible&r by right-clicking it.
university.eidartifice.desc5: If you do the step incorrectly, or wait too long to do the next step, the &6craft will fail&r, losing everything you threw in and making you start over.
university.resolutebelt.subtitle: Make a Resolute Belt
university.resolutebelt.desc1: While wearing a &bResolute Belt&r, it will &6negate nearly all knockback&r from enemies.
university.resolutebelt.desc2: In fact, it will actually reflect some back on your attacker!
university.gravitybelt.subtitle: Make a Gravity Belt
university.gravitybelt.desc1: While wearing a &bGravity Belt&r, it will &6remove 60%% of your gravity&r!
university.gravitybelt.desc2: This is good for reaching high places (and getting back down), and is just generally fun to use.
university.soulfirewand.subtitle: Make a Soulfire Wand
university.soulfirewand.desc: The &bSoulfire Wand&r shoots a projectile that does &6roughly as much damage as a Diamond Sword&r.
university.glasshand.subtitle: Make a Glass Hand
university.glasshand.desc1: The &bGlass Hand&r is a very dangerous item.
university.glasshand.desc2: While worn, it will &6double all damage dealt&r, but will also &cquintuple all damage received&r.
university.bonechillwand.subtitle: Make a Bonechill Wand
university.bonechillwand.desc: The &bBonechill Wand&r fires a projectile that &6prevents health regeneration&r.
university.wickedweave.title: Warlock's Armor
university.wickedweave.subtitle: Make a set of Warlock's Armor
university.wickedweave.desc1: The &bWarlock's Hat&r boosts outgoing magic and wither damage by 50%%.
university.wickedweave.desc2: The &bWarlock's Cloak&r reduces incoming magic and wither damage by 50%%.
university.wickedweave.desc3: The &bWarlock's Boots&r reduce the slowing effects of terrain and obstacles by 50%%, as well as preventing the Slowness effect entirely.
university.inversionpick.subtitle: Make a Pickaxe of Inversion
university.inversionpick.desc: The &bPickaxe of Inversion&r is &6faster at mining hard blocks&r and &6slower at mining soft blocks&r.
university.prestigiouspalm.subtitle: Make the Prestigious Palm
university.prestigiouspalm.desc: The &bPrestigious Palm&r, when worn, &6doubles your reach&r.
university.mindplate.title: SCP-148
university.mindplate.subtitle: Make the Mind-Shielding Plate
university.mindplate.desc: The &bMind-Shielding Plate&r, when worn, will &6allow you to keep 2/3 of your experience on death&r, and grants immunity to Nausea.
university.voidamulet.subtitle: Make the Void Amulet
university.voidamulet.desc1: The &bVoid Amulet&r, when worn, will &6absorb and nullify a single projectile that hits the wearer&r.
university.voidamulet.desc2: Afterwards, it takes 10 seconds to recharge.
university.wardedmail.subtitle: Make Warded Mail
university.cleavingaxe.subtitle: Make the Axe of Cleaving
university.cleavingaxe.desc: The &bAxe of Cleaving&r has a chance of &6dropping heads&r when used to kill mobs.
university.reaperscythe.subtitle: Make the Reaper's Scythe
university.reaperscythe.desc: The &bReapers Scythe&r has a chance of &6dropping Soul Shards&r when used to kill undead mobs.
university.soulenchanter.subtitle: Make the Soul Enchanter
university.soulenchanter.desc1: The &bSoul Enchanter&r allows you to &6add a single level of an enchantment&r to an item.
university.soulenchanter.desc2: It also &6works on already enchanted items&r! You can keep adding more and more levels of an enchantment to it, up to its maximum.
university.soulenchanter.desc3: This makes it &6easy to get very powerful enchantments&r, like Efficiency V and so on.
university.soulenchanter.desc4: Rather than using a large amount of experience, each enchantment takes only a few levels and some Soul Shards.
university.matsandyou.subtitle: Make Materials and You
university.matsandyou.desc1: &bMaterials and You&r is the first of the mod's guide books.
university.matsandyou.desc2: As the mod updates, more pages are likely to be added.
university.partbuilder.subtitle: Make the Part Builder
university.partbuilder.desc1: The &bPart Builder&r is where you &6make lower-tier tool parts&r. Basically, anything that isn't metal.
university.partbuilder.desc2: Place a &bPattern&r in the left slot, &6choose which part&r you want to make out of the list, then &6insert the material&r you want to make a part of.
university.partbuilder.desc3: Only tier 1 materials can be used in the Part Builder, check Materials and You for a list.
university.partbuilder.desc4: On the right, you can &6see the material's stats&r. You can hover over lines to see more information on them.
university.partbuilder.desc5: Take the part out of the right slot to craft it, using up the materials and Pattern.
university.mattiers.title: Reading Rainbow
university.mattiers.subtitle: Make the Encyclopedia of Tinkering
university.mattiers.desc1: The &bEncyclopedia of Tinkering&r shows &6all tools, materials, and modifiers&r from all tiers.
university.mattiers.desc2: &nTier 1 materials&r are common and simple, and need nothing more than a &6Part Builder&r.
university.mattiers.desc3: &nTier 2 materials&r require &6melting and casting&r to make.
university.mattiers.desc4: &nTier 3 materials&r require &6alloying&r, through an Alloyer or Smeltery.
university.partchest.subtitle: Make a Part Chest
university.partchest.desc1: The &bPart Chest&r can &6store Parts&r in stacks of up to 16.
university.partchest.desc2: When placed adjacent to other Tinker's tables, you can &6swap between them all&r inside the GUI of any.
university.modchest.subtitle: Make a Modifier Chest
university.modchest.desc1: The &bModifier Chest&r can &6store items that can be used as modifiers&r in stacks of up to 16.
university.modchest.desc2: Granted, some items (like Redstone) really don't do much 16 at a time, so it's not the most useful thing.
university.tinkerstation.subtitle: Make a Tinker Station
university.tinkerstation.desc1: The &bTinker Station&r is where you combine parts to &6make tools&r.
university.tinkerstation.desc2: &6Select the tool&r you want to make on the left, then &6insert the parts&r in the center.
university.tinkerstation.desc3: Along the right, you can &6see the tool's stats and modifiers&r.
university.modifiers.title: Modifier Types
university.modifiers.subtitle: Learn about the types of modifiers
university.modifiers.desc2: &6Upgrades&r give some kind of boost, like speed, damage, etc. These &6take up Upgrade slots&r.
university.modifiers.desc3: &6Abilities&r give more unique, well, abilities. These are things like fortune, silk touch, autosmelting, etc. These &6take up Ability slots&r, which are harder to come by.
university.modifiers.desc4: &6Free&r modifiers don't take up any slots of any kind whatsoever. These tend to be somewhat weaker (like making your tool glow), or passive (like &ogiving you more upgrade slots&r).
university.modifiers.desc5: &6Traits&r are inherent to a part's material. Stone parts always give Stonebound, Flint always gives Jagged, etc. Sometimes, materials may have lower stats but a better trait as a trade-off.
university.tinkersanvil.title: Tinker's Anvil
university.tinkersanvil.subtitle: Make a Tinker's Anvil
university.tinkersanvil.desc1: The &bTinker's Anvil&r is used to &6make more complex tools&r.
university.tinkersanvil.desc2: Other than that, it works basically the same as the Tinker Station. The difference in material is only aesthetic.
university.melter.title: &mS&rmelter&my&r
university.melter.subtitle: Make the Melter
university.melter.desc1: The &bMelter&r is a multiblock that allows you to &6melt metals into fluids&r.
university.melter.desc2: Place the &bSeared Heater&r, provide it with solid fuel, then place the &bSeared Melter&r on top.
university.melter.desc3: It can smelt up to 3 items at a time, and can hold 9 ingots' worth of molten metal.
university.melter.desc4: Additionally, &6melting ores will produce an additional 1/3 of an ingot&r.
university.casting.title: Casting
university.casting.subtitle: Cast some molten metal
university.casting.desc1: To &ouse&r molten metal, place a &bSeared Faucet&r on the Melter (or whatever block is storing the fluid).
university.casting.desc2: Place the &bCasting Table&r or &bCasting Basin&r underneath.
university.casting.desc3: If a recipe requires inserting an item into the Table/Basin, insert it. &6Right-click the Faucet&r to pour the metal into the Table/Basin.
university.casting.desc4: To make tool parts, you need &bCasts&r. There are two types of Cast: Sand and Gold.
university.casting.desc5: &6Sand Casts&r can only be used once, but are very cheap. To use them, insert a &6Blank Sand Cast&r onto the Table, then &6use a Part&r on it.
university.casting.desc6: This will essentially make a hole in the Cast in the shape of the Part, making a Sand Cast for it. Pour the molten metal on this to create the Part.
university.casting.desc7: &bGold Casts&r are reusable but more expensive. Insert a Part onto an empty Table, and &6pour Molten Gold on it&r.
university.casting.desc8: This will destroy the Part, but makes a Gold Cast of that Part.
university.smeltbooks.title: Cook Books
university.smeltbooks.subtitle: Make the next two Books
university.smeltbooks.desc1: &bPuny Smelting&r has a list of all &6Tier 2 materials&r, information on the Melter, as well as &6upgrade and slotless modifiers&r.
university.smeltbooks.desc2: &bMighty Smelting&r has &6Tier 3&r, information on the Smeltery, &6Broad Tools&r (tools that need the Tinker's Anvil), and &6ability modifiers&r..
university.smeltery.title: Smeltery
university.smeltery.subtitle: Make a Smeltery
university.smeltery.desc1: The &bSmeltery&r is a multiblock that &6melts metals&r and &6combines molten metals into alloys&r.
university.smeltery.desc2: Its shape is much more freeform than the Melter. Basically, make any rectangular shape out of &bSeared Blocks&r (anywhere from 1x1 to 13x13 internal).
university.smeltery.desc3: Then, one block above and one layer out (so it's placed diagonally above), place a ring of Seared blocks (without corners).
university.smeltery.desc4: In this ring, place a &bSmeltery Controller&r and &bSeared Fuel Tank&r. The Smeltery can be up to 65 blocks tall, including the floor. You also need to have a &bSeared Drain&r anywhere in the structure. If the structure is invalid, &6it will show you what parts are wrong&r when you right-click it.
university.smeltery.desc5: If the structure is valid, you will be able to open the Controller's GUI. Give the Fuel Tank fluid fuel (for now, Lava), and any metals you give it will be melted. Molten metals can be pulled from the Drain.
university.smeltery.desc6: &6Some molten metals mix, creating alloys&r. This only happens if you have fuel, so a massive Smeltery with no fuel will function as a safe tank for storing molten metals.
university.smeltery.desc7: The more Seared blocks that make up the Smeltery, the more fuel is used up.
university.smeltery.desc8: Ores melted in the Smeltery are doubled.
university.smelteryio.title: Smeltery IO
university.smelteryio.subtitle: Make the Chute and Duct
university.smelteryio.desc1: The &bChute&r allows you to &6automatically input and output items&r.
university.smelteryio.desc2: The &bDuct&r allows you to &6filter fluid IO&r using buckets or cans.
university.blazing.title: Mob Melting
university.blazing.subtitle: Get a Blazing Blood Bucket
university.blazing.desc1: You can get certain fluids by &6melting mobs&r. Basically, make sure there's any molten metal in the Smeltery, then physically shove a mob into the working area.
university.blazing.desc2: &6Melting a Blaze&r is the only way to get &bBlazing Blood&r, which is a &6much hotter Smeltery fuel&r.
university.blazing.desc3: Some materials can only be melted with Blazing Blood, and certain Alloys need its heat as well.
university.foundry.title: Foundry
university.foundry.subtitle: Make a Foundry
university.foundry.desc1: The &bFoundry&r is a multiblock, similar to the Smeltery. It is built in the same way, though &6you must include the edges and corners&r.
university.foundry.desc2: The Foundry &6cannot alloy&r and &6stores more fluid&r. Ores smelted will &6make a bit of certain other metals&r, but &6less of that ore's&r. 1 Iron Ore gives 1 ingot and 6 nuggets of iron, as well as 3 nuggets of nickel, for instance.
university.foundry.desc3: There are also Scorched versions of all the other Seared parts, like the Faucet and Casting Table.
university.alloyer.subtitle: Make the Scorched Alloyer
university.alloyer.desc: The &bScorched Alloyer&r will &6alloy the fluids in tanks adjacent to it&r, using fuel from a tank beneath it.
university.foundrybook.subtitle: Make Fantastic Foundry
university.foundrybook.desc: &bFantastic Foundry&r has information on Blazing Blood, the Foundry, and Tier 4 materials.
university.mechbook.subtitle: Make Mechanical Tinkering
university.mechbook.desc: &bMechanical Tinkering&r is the book for &eTinkers' Mechworks&r, an addon that adds a couple handy machines.
university.firestarter.subtitle: Make a Firestarter
university.firestarter.desc1: The &bFirestarter&r lights a fire when given a redstone signal.
university.firestarter.desc2: You can set it to snuff the fire when the signal is removed, or allow it to stay until snuffed by an outside source.
university.drawbridge.subtitle: Make a Drawbridge
university.drawbridge.desc1: The &bDrawbridge&r, when powered, will &6place a line of blocks&r in the direction it is facing.
university.drawbridge.desc2: It can place up to 16 blocks away, using blocks from its inventory. When unpowered, the blocks will be broken and replaced into the inventory.
university.drawbridge.desc3: If it has no room in its inventory, the blocks will be dropped into the world.
university.drawups.title: Drawbridge Upgrades
university.drawups.subtitle: Make a Drawbridge Upgrade
university.drawups.desc1: &bSpeed Upgrades&r make the Drawbridge place and break blocks faster.
university.drawups.desc2: &bDrawbridge Distance Upgrades&r allow the Drawbridge to place blocks further.
university.drawups.desc3: The &bAdvanced Drawbridge Upgrade&r will allow you to set what each block that gets placed will be, so it doesn't have to be only a single block.
university.gadgetbook.subtitle: Make Tinker's Gadgetry
university.gadgetbook.desc1: &bTinker's Gadgetry&r will eventually have a list of all gadgets added by the mod.
university.gadgetbook.desc2: For now, it doesn't say much of anything though.
university.pigback.subtitle: Make a Piggybackpack
university.pigback.desc1: Right-click the &bPiggybackpack&r on a mob to &6carry it on your back&r. You cannot wear a Chestplate while doing this.
university.pigback.desc2: To put the mob down, simply unequip the Piggybackpack from your chestplate slot.
university.pigback.desc3: This is very useful for moving Blazes for &6Blazing Blood&r, though you may want to have fire protection.
university.efln.title: Not For Use Indoors
university.efln.subtitle: Make some EFLN
university.efln.desc2: It does very little damage to mobs, doesn't harm items, and &6drops all the blocks it breaks&r, so it's very useful for mining.
university.efln.desc3: &cDO NOT USE INDOORS!&r To be safe, don't even &ohold&r them in your base. You will 100%% accidentally throw it at your Chest when you try to open it, and you'll have to load a backup.
university.clearglass.title: Quite Clear
university.clearglass.subtitle: Make some Clear Glass
university.clearglass.desc: &bClear Glass&r is completely clear, no borders between blocks! It's purely decorative, not the most important thing, but it's nice.
university.slimeboots.title: Slime Boots
university.slimeboots.subtitle: Make Slime Boots
university.slimeboots.desc1: &bSlime Boots&r prevent fall damage, and &6make you bounce&r instead!
university.slimeboots.desc2: They work amazingly when used with the Slime Sling.
university.slimeboots.desc3: Sneak to stop bouncing, though it will give fall damage. All colors are the same.
university.slimesling.title: Slime Slings
university.slimesling.subtitle: Make a Slime Sling
university.slimesling.desc1: &bSlime Slings&r allow you to move in cooler ways, each type being different.
university.slimesling.desc2: Normal Slime will launch you in the direction opposite of where you're looking, when standing and aiming at a block.
university.slimesling.desc3: Skyslime will launch you in the direction you look, but is weaker and works mid-air.
university.slimesling.desc4: Ichor will instead launch the mob you are looking at.
university.slimesling.desc5: Enderslime will teleport you through the wall you are aiming at.
university.cans.subtitle: Make a Can
university.cans.desc2: They &ccannot pick up or pour fluids&r, but they can stack up to 16.
university.tinkerslime.title: Tinker Slimes
university.tinkerslime.subtitle: Learn where to get the new Slimes
university.tinkerslime.desc1: &bSkyslimes&r can be found in &6floating islands&r around the world.
university.tinkerslime.desc2: &bEnderslimes&r can be found in &6the End&r, naturally.
university.tinkerslime.desc3: &bCoagulated Blood&r technically isn't a slime, but you get it from damaging mobs in the Smeltery.
university.tinkerslime.desc4: &bIchor&r drops from Orange Slimes, which spawn in islands in &6the Nether&r.
university.coolthings.title: Cool Things
university.coolthings.subtitle: Buy a random cool thing
university.coolthings.desc1: Mods add a lot of &bcool things&r. &lSo&r many cool things that we can't really make a quest for all of them.
university.coolthings.desc2: This quest will take 5 levels' worth of experience (55 points, specifically) and give you a &6Loot Crate&r.
university.coolthings.desc3: Use the Loot Crate to get a random Cool Thing™ from it (sneak to use the whole stack). Some are useful, some aren't, but &oall&r are Cool™.
university.epicfightmod.title: Epic Fight Mod
university.epicfightmod.subtitle: Learn about Epic Fight Mod
university.epicfightmod.desc1: &eEpic Fight Mod&r is a &6complete overhaul of Minecraft's combat system&r.
university.epicfightmod.desc2: Most vanilla enemies have been revamped with &6new animation and behavior&r.
university.epicfightmod.desc3: To toggle between &6build mode&r (normal mode, basically) amd &6battle mode&r, press &6B&r (changed by us, it normally defaults to R).
university.epicfightmod.desc4: In battle mode, you get some new attack and movement options. Simple attacks, as well as attacks while sprinting, have been changed.
university.epicfightmod.desc5: There are also two more mechanics, special attacks and stun, which are taught in &6the two quests to the left&r.
university.epicfightmod.reward1: Hey read the Epic Fight Mod quest
univeristy.epfspecial.title: Special Attacks and Skills
univeristy.epfspecial.subtitle: Learn about special attacks and skills
univeristy.epfspecial.desc1: Every melee weapon has a &bspecial attack&r, depending on what &6type of weapon&r it is (sword, axe, etc). Hold &6P&r while hovering over the item to see its special attack, as well as its other stats.
univeristy.epfspecial.desc2: As you deal damage, the &6bottom right of your screen&r will show a number. That number is your &6progress percentage&r to being able to use it.
univeristy.epfspecial.desc3: To perform a special attack (best appreciated in third person), simply &6hold down the attack button&r.
univeristy.epfspecial.desc4: &bSkill Books&r can be found in dungeon chests, and provide certain bonuses when learned. There are three skill types: Dodge, Guard, and Passive. &6Only one of each can be active at a time.&r
univeristy.epfspecial.desc5: Certain skills use &6Stamina&r, which shows as a bar in the bottom right. Heavier armor increases the stamina cost. Stamina only regenerates after not using it for some time.
university.epfstun.title: Stun
university.epfstun.subtitle: Learn about Stun
university.epfstun.desc1: &bStun&r replaces knockback. The higher &6impact&r a weapon has (as well as higher knockback), the more it stuns a mob.
university.epfstun.desc2: Higher &6weight&r lowers stun. Player weight is based on worn armor, and mob weight is twice their max health. Higher weight adds a delay before you can be stunned again.
university.tinyredstone.title: Tiny Redstone
university.tinyredstone.subtitle: Make stuff from Tiny Redstone
university.tinyredstone.desc1: &eTiny Redstone&r allows you to make &6redstone circuits in a single block&r.
university.tinyredstone.desc2: Place down a &bRedstone Panel&r, and then you can place down any number of &bTiny Components&r on it.
university.tinyredstone.desc3: &bTiny Redstone Dust&r only transfers powers along its connections. Right-click the side of a Dust component to toggle if it connects on that side.
university.tinyredstone.desc4: &bTiny Redstone Torches&r never stand on the ground. Instead, they always connect to the component behind it, including Dust.
university.tinyredstone.desc5: Certain components can interact with blocks outside of the Panel, like Comparators and pretty much anything that just carries a signal.
university.tinyredstone.desc6: &6Adjacent Panels can interact fully.&r Tiny Pistons can move Tiny Blocks from one Panel to another, etc.
university.krate.title: I Feel Krate!
university.krate.subtitle: Make a Krate
university.krate.desc1: &bKrates&r come in &6 4 tiers&r, each storing more. The first tier stores 9 stacks, the highest storing 144.
university.krate.desc2: You can use &bKrate Upgrades&r on the block to increase their tier without breaking them.
university.krateupgrades.title: Krate Upgrades
university.krateupgrades.subtitle: Make Krate Upgrades
university.krateupgrades.desc1: The &bItem Filter&r, when inserted into the top left slot of a Krate, will &6only allow certain items into the Krate&r.
university.krateupgrades.desc2: Add items to the Filter by using it in your hand and inserting items. It defaults to a whitelist, but you can set it to a blacklist instead. You can also set it to use/ignore tags or NBT.
university.krateupgrades.desc3: The &bHopper Upgrade&r adds a button to the right that allows you to &6make it push and pull from adjacent inventories&r. You can also set a whitelist for each.
university.krateupgrades.desc4: The &bCollector Upgrade&r allows you to make the Krate &6pick up nearby dropped items&r. Its button allows you to set the area (increasing "D" increases the downward distance it checks; check out the &6Visualize&r button&r.
university.krateupgrades.desc5: The &bShulker Upgrade&r allows you to &6break the Krate without it losing its items&r.
university.krateupgrades.desc6: The &bCompacting Upgrade&r will make the Krate &6try to craft all items into a compressed version&r using either a 2x2 or 3x3 recipe (toggled with a button on the right). This is great for, say, Cobblestone and Ingots. It's less good for Planks, as they'd be made into Crafting Tables.
university.glassential.title: Glassential
university.glassential.subtitle: Make a Glass from Glassential
university.glassential.desc1: &eGlassential&r adds some nice &bGlass blocks&r that provide some much-needed utility.
university.glassential.desc2: Each has a &6tooltip&r explaining what it does
university.cursedearth.title: Cursed Earth
university.cursedearth.subtitle: Get Cursed Earth
university.cursedearth.desc1: &bCursed Earth&r (from the mod &eCursed Earth&r) &6rapidly spawns monsters&r on top of it.
university.cursedearth.desc2: Get it by &6sneak right-clicking Dirt with a Wither Rose&r. It will spread to nearby Dirt if it's dark enough, but will &cburn in sunlight&r.
university.cursedearth.desc3: Cursed Earth will only spawn mobs that can spawn there normally. It only spawns Wither Skeletons if placed in Nether Fortresses, for example.
university.trashcans.title: me irl
university.trashcans.subtitle: Make a Trash Can
university.trashcans.desc1: &bTrash Cans&r will &6instantly delete anything piped into them&r.
university.trashcans.desc2: Item Trash Cans can only delete items, etc. The Ultimate Trash Can can delete all.
university.trashcans.desc3: In their GUIs, you can set a &6whitelist/blacklist&r of 9 items/fluids, or set the maximum FE/t it accepts.
university.craftcalc.subtitle: Make a Crafting Calculator
university.craftcalc.desc1: The &bCrafting Calculator&r is an &nextremely&r useful item. You can teach it recipes, and it will &6display the base ingredients of an item&r.
university.craftcalc.desc2: To start, open the Crafting Calculator, search for the item you want in JEI, and &6drag it into the top left slot&r. At the bottom, it will show the ingredients the Calculator thinks it needs. Since you haven't given it a recipe yet, it will simply show the item itself.
university.craftcalc.desc3: To &6teach it a recipe&r, click the button at the top right. Here, you can add &6labels&r (which represent items, fluids, OreDict terms, and placeholders, as well as their amounts) for the inputs, outputs, as well as the block used to craft it.
university.craftcalc.desc4: You can also &6use JEI's + button&r to instantly create labels for that recipe. Additionally, dragging an item from JEI into a slot creates a label for it.
university.craftcalc.desc5: At the top of this GUI, you can set the recipe's &6group&r (so you can organize your recipes), &6save&r the recipe (so it can be used), &6add label&r (which should be fairly obvious), &6clear grid&r (resets the GUI), &6edit recipe&r (if you are changing an existing recipe), and &6disambiguate&r (specify a label, in case it's too generic).
university.craftcalc.desc6: Once a recipe has been taught, go back to the Calculator's first menu. Put the label you want in the top left slot, and it will &6display the ingredients it needs in the bottom&r. You can also set the amount you want in the text box.
university.craftcalc.desc7: These recipes &6nest&r, meaning if you have the recipes for a Bookshelf, Planks, Books, and Paper, it will show the correct amounts of Logs, Leather, and Sugar Cane you need.
university.craftcalc2.title: Placeholders
university.craftcalc2.subtitle: Learn how to use placeholders
university.craftcalc2.desc1: Recipes only have 14 slots for input labels. This is good enough for most recipes, but not all.
university.craftcalc2.desc2: A &bplaceholder&r is a label that essentially &6represents up to 14 other labels&r. That means a recipe with 2 placeholders could actually have up to 28 inputs.
university.craftcalc2.desc3: Go into the new recipe screen, click Add Label, go to Placeholder, then give it a name. Place this in the output. Place up to 14 input labels, then save it as a recipe.
university.craftcalc2.desc4: Then in the actual item recipe that you want, instead of putting those 14 input labels, &6put the Placeholder there instead&r.
university.craftcalc2.desc5: Placeholders are fairly tedious to make, so I recommend &6bookmarking&r (hit A while hovering over) all the items in the main recipe, then removing them as they're added to the placeholder's recipe.
university.compressium.title: Compressium
university.compressium.subtitle: Make a Compressed block
university.compressium.desc1: &eCompressium&r allows you to craft &bCompressed versions of many blocks&r, which makes them &6easier to store&r.
university.compressium.desc2: For instance, craft 9 Cobble to make 1 Compressed Cobble. 9 Compressed Cobble crafts into a &6Compressed Cobble (2x)&r, etc.
university.compressium.desc3: This means you can store a large amount of certain blocks without having to use a lot of storage space.
university.cnb.title: Micromanaging
university.cnb.subtitle: Make a Chisel
university.cnb.desc1: &bChisels&r, from the mod &eChisels \& Bits&r, when left-clicked on a block, will &6remove a bit of it&r, literally!
university.cnb.desc2: A block is made of 4096 &6Bits&r, 16x16x16. You can place Bits back in the world for decoration, and you can &6combine different blocks' Bits in the same blockspace&r.
university.cnb.desc3: If a blockspace is full of the same block's Bits, it will reform into the block.
university.cnb.desc4: Holding &6Left Alt&r while holding a Chisel or Bit will allow you to &6choose the breaking/placing shape&r (if it does 1 by 1, a quarter of the blockspace at a time, etc).
university.bitbag.title: Bag of Bit Holding
university.bitbag.subtitle: Make a Chiseled Bit Bag
university.bitbag.desc1: One block is made out of 4096 Bits. That is 64 stacks of Bits per block. The &bChiseled Bit Bag&r will &6automatically pick up Bits&r and stores them, up to 512 a slot.
university.bitbag.desc2: When placing Bits, it will try to place them from the Bag's inventory before your own.
university.bittank.title: Fluid Bits
university.bittank.subtitle: Make the Chiseled Bit Storage
university.bittank.desc1: The &bChiseled Bit Storage&r is used to make &6fluid Bits&r. Right-click a bucket into it, then right-click with an empty hand to make a stack of Bits using it.
university.bittank.desc2: &cDo not use it to store solid Bits. That part is very buggy.&r
university.mmmmmmmmmmmm.title: Dummies Are Not For Fighting!
university.mmmmmmmmmmmm.subtitle: Make a Test Dummy
university.mmmmmmmmmmmm.desc1: The &bTest Dummy&r will &6display the amount of damage dealt to it&r, so you can accurately see how powerful your weapons are.
university.mmmmmmmmmmmm.desc2: You can click &6armor&r on it to equip it. Sneak right-click with an empty hand to remove the armor.
university.mmmmmmmmmmmm.desc3: Giving it the head of an undead mob will &6make it undead&r, so it takes more Smite damage. A Turtle Helmet will &6make it a water mob&r, and a Pillager Banner will &6make it a Pillager&r, as far as damage goes.
university.mmmmmmmmmmmm.desc4: Punch it with an empty hand while sneaking to &6disassemble&r it.
university.annoyingsounds.title: Aurora Borealis?
university.annoyingsounds.subtitle: Learn how to disable potentially annoying mods
university.annoyingsounds.desc1: The mod &eDynamic Surroundings&r adds audio and visual effects to &6make the world prettier&r. It's also where auroras, noisy waterfalls, and similar effects come from.
university.annoyingsounds.desc2: You can configure it with the keybind &6control + V&r.
university.quarkenchant.title: ᑑ⚍ᔑ∷ꖌ ╎ᓭ ᔑ ᒲ↸ ʖ|| ⍊ᔑ⨅ꖌ╎╎
university.quarkenchant.subtitle: Make a Matrix Enchanting Table
university.quarkenchant.desc1: &eQuark Oddities&r adds the &bMatrix Enchanting Table&r, which allows you to &6pick and choose what enchantments you get&r through a Tetris-like minigame.
university.quarkenchant.desc2: Enchantments are represented by &6pieces&r. Click the + button to spend some xp, adding a piece to the list on the right. &6The more Bookshelves you have, the more pieces you can create.&r
university.quarkenchant.desc3: Enchant the item by &6moving a piece from the list to the grid&r. Right-click a piece to rotate it. You &6can have as many enchantments as you can fit&r in the grid.
university.quarkenchant.desc4: If you have multiple pieces of the same enchantment, place them on top of each other to upgrade their level.
university.quarkenchant.desc5: &6Candles&r from &eQuark&r can be placed nearby to &6influence what enchantment pieces are made&r. We've added JEI info tabs to each color to say which enchantments they influence.
university.backpack.subtitle: Make a Backpack
university.backpack.desc1: The &bBackpack&r from &eQuark Oddities&r, when &6worn as a chestplate&r, will &6double your inventory capacity&r.
university.backpack.desc2: While there's something inside the Backpack, you &ccannot take it off until it is emptied&r.
university.cobblegen.title: Simple Cobble Gen
university.cobblegen.subtitle: Make a Cobble Gen
university.cobblegen.desc1: &bCobble Gens&r as the names imply, &6generate Cobblestone&r.
university.cobblegen.desc2: There are 5 tiers; &6higher tiers work faster&r.
university.cobblegen.desc3: Cobble gens will also &6push their Cobble into an inventory above them&r.
university.chisel.title: Chisel
university.chisel.subtitle: Make something with Chisel
university.chisel.desc2: To make them, first craft a &bChisel&r. Higher tier ones are more durable and offer more options for how they're used.
university.chisel.desc3: Place the block you want to chisel in the left slot, then choose the block you want to chisel it into on the right.
university.chisel.desc4: Higher-tier Chisels allow you to choose the block then &6left-click blocks in the world to Chisel them&r.
university.chisel.desc5: The &bAuto Chisel&r allows you to automatically chisel blocks. Place a Chisel in the center slot, and the chiseled block you want to make in the slot underneath. Place ingredient items in the left, and it will output the chiseled block to the right.
university.chisel.desc6: By default, it does not use FE. Some modpacks may change this, however. We don't, so you can just ignore that part.
university.compactmachines.title: Compact Machines
university.compactmachines.subtitle: Make a Compact Machine
university.compactmachines.desc1: &bCompact Machines&r, from the mod of the same name, are &6bigger on the inside&r. You can have anything you want runnning inside. &6If the chunk the Machine is in is loaded, the inside of the Machine is loaded.&r In this pack, they are crafted using the mod &eCompact Crafting&r.
university.compactmachines.desc2: Make 4 &bField Projectors&r, and place one in the world. Right-click it, and it will show you &6valid positions to place another&r. The further you place it away, &6the bigger the crafting area&r is. Place it down (facing the first one), and then right-click &othat&r. Place the other 2 where indicated.
university.compactmachines.desc3: If done properly, it should make a glowing cube. &6This is the crafting area.&r
university.compactmachines.desc4: Place the blocks according to their recipe. The very bottom items in the recipe are the block ingredients. Above and to the left is the &6item you have to throw in&r to start the craft.
university.compactmachines.desc5: Each tier of &bCompact Machine&r has more space inside than the last. Each have been given a tooltip with their internal volume.
university.compactmachines.desc6: Place down a Compact Machine and use the &bPersonal Shrinking Device&r on it to enter it. You will normally spawn in the center of the floor, but you can &6sneak right-click the PSD to change the entrance point&r. Use the PSD again to leave.
university.compactmachines.desc7: On any Wall on the inside of a machine, you can place an &bItem Tunnel&r, which &6connects that block to one of the outer faces&r of the Machine. Right-click the Tunnel to set which face it is connecting to.
university.blockcarpentry.title: BlockCarpentry
university.blockcarpentry.subtitle: Make something from BlockCarpentry
university.blockcarpentry.desc1: &eBlockCarpentry&r is a mod that allows you to &6make stairs, slabs, fences, etc out of any block&r.
university.blockcarpentry.desc2: Right-click a block on a &bFrame&r to &6set the Frame to use that block's textures&r.
university.blockcarpentry.desc3: For blocks that have different textures per side (like Furnaces), the Frame will &6only use the block's top texture&r.
university.blockcarpentry.desc4: &bIllusion Blocks&r will correctly &6have different textures per side&r to match the block you set it to.
university.bctools.title: Decoration Tools
university.bctools.subtitle: Make the various BlockCarpentry tools
university.bctools.desc1:
The &bHammer&r will &6remove blocks from Frames&r.

The &bTexture Wrench&r will &6change what texture is used, or rotate the block&r.

The &bChisel&r can be used on doors, trapdoors, fences and gates, chests, beds, and walls to &6change their model&r.

The &bPaintbrush&r will &6recolor accessories&r added by the Chisel.
university.bctools.desc2: &bCharcoal&r, &bCoal&r, and &bGlowstone Dust&r will &6make Frames glow&r. THe more you give it, the brighter it glows.
university.projectred.title: Project Red
university.projectred.subtitle: Make some stuff from Project Red
university.projectred.desc1: &eProject Red&r is a mod (or rather, a series of mods) that &6improve redstone&r.
university.projectred.desc2: &bWires&r carry redstone signals without losing strength, and &6can be placed on walls and ceilings&r.
university.projectred.desc3: Insulated Wires will &6only connect to Wires of the same color&r, or uninsulated Wire.
university.projectred.desc4: Bundled Cables can connect to Insulated Wires, and transmit their signals. You can dye these further to make even more complex setups.
university.projectred.desc5: Each also can be &6Framed&r, allowing it to be &6freestanding&r, so it doesn't need to be placed on blocks.
university.projectred.desc6: &bGates&r are essentially what you'd think. An OR Gate will output a signal if any of its inputs have a signal. Basically, you either know what these do or you don't.
university.projectred.desc7: The mod also adds several &bIllumination&r options, like Lamps and Lanterns.
university.dank.title: Donk Null
university.dank.subtitle: Make a Dank
university.dank.desc1: &bDanks&r, from the mod &eDank Storage&r, can &6automatically pick up items&r, can &6store items at >64 items per stack&r, and allow for you to &6use stored items without removing them&r, including tools and food!. Higher tiers have more slots, and can store more per slot.
university.dank.desc2: Danks have two modes: &6Bag&r and &6Construction&r. There is a keybind to move between them (default is i).
university.dank.desc3:
In &6Bag&r mode, it works like a backpack. Right-click it to open its GUI to access its items. Control-click a slot to lock it, so it doesn't get replaced when emptied. You can also set whether or not it automatically picks up items. There are 4 settings you can click through:
&6Normal&r is disabled 
&6Pickup All&r picks up everything 
&6Filtered Pickup&r only picks up what it already has
